Run analysis

Source: R/study_analyse.R
study_analyse.Rd

Run the analyses on the data

study_analyse(study)

study_analyze(study)

Arguments

study

A study list object with class reg_study

Value

A study object with class reg_study

Examples


s <- study() %>%
  add_hypothesis("H1", "Petal width and length will be positively correlated.") %>%
  add_analysis("A1", cor.test(dat$Petal.Width, dat$Petal.Length)) %>%
  add_criterion("sig", "p.value", "<", 0.05) %>%
  add_criterion("pos", "estimate", ">", 0) %>%
  add_eval("corroboration",
           "Petal width is significantly and positively correlated to length",
           "sig & pos") %>%
  add_eval("falsification",
           "Petal width is significantly and negatively correlated to length",
           "sig & !pos") %>%
  add_data("dat", iris) %>%
  study_analyse()
#> Hypothesis H1, Criterion sig: p.value < 0.05 is TRUE (p.value = 0)
#> Hypothesis H1, Criterion pos: estimate > 0 is TRUE (estimate = 0.96)
#> Hypothesis H1, Evaluation: corroborate
study_json(s)
